results.title: Paintings need care
results.brief_description: English version by J.L. Levi-Alvares. Set to the background music of Handel, J.C.Bach and Vivaldi, this film illustrates how paintings stored in the National Museum of Warsaw which have been damaged by time or during wartime occupation of Poland, are restored. It shows the careful and painstaking skills required to once again allow these paintings to take their rightful place on the walls of the Museum.

results.creator_credit: H Tyrlova, K Hutecka and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: An animated film in which a mother brush and a father brush paint a baby brush and defend it against an ugly bad brush. No commentary, music only.

results.title: Painting with calligraphy
results.creator_credit: Eliot O'Hara and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The history of calligraphy - or picture writing - in art is traced from prehistoric times to the present day. Varied used of calligraphy are shown in demonstrations by Eliot O’Hara, George Post, and Paul Travis, and in examples from the works of Burchfield, Dufy, Klee, Marin and Van Gogh.

results.title: Painting the Chinese landscape
results.creator_credit: Wan-go Wen and China Film Enterprises of America
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the four important steps in painting a Chinese landscape. Starting with a blank sheet of paper, we see the artist outline his layout, fill in his brush work, group together the related parts with shading, and finally retouch for emphasis.

results.title: Painting shadows
results.creator_credit: Eliot O'Hara and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: With demonstrations and teaching devices, Eliot O’Hara relates the physical laws of light to the specific needs of the art student. In his own painting of a two-storey white house in sunlight, Eliot O’Hara shows the application of the four basic elements of lighting: the direct light of the sun; shadow influenced by sky; shadow with reflected light, and shadow with very dim light.

results.title: Painting an abstraction
results.brief_description: Eliot O’Hara, American artist and teacher, presents his own technique of “abstracting” desired elements for a water-colour painting. He emphasises the careful arrangement of planes and colour in a unique pattern. The same subject - treated in the film “Painting reflections in water” is used to show how purpose influences choice and technique.

results.title: Painting a province
results.creator_credit: Kirk Jones, Peter Jones and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: New Brunswick’s rugged coasts, peaceful farms and burgeoning towns have inspired artists for generations. This film shows paintings of both past and present-day artists. Seen in the film are Alex Colville, Jack Humphrey, Miller Brittain, Fred Ross, sculptor Claude Roussel, and artist-teacher Lawren Harris.

results.title: Painted daughters (1925)
results.brief_description: Painted Daughters is a romantic melodrama about high society and the “flapper” generation. It tells the story of Mary Elliot and Courtland Nixon, dancing partners in the stage show “Floradora”. Mary forsakes Courtland and marries a wealthy admirer, who soon goes bankrupt and suicides, leaving her to raise a little daughter, Maryon. Following in her mother’s footsteps Maryon eventually finds success in a theatrical career. A press agent, Ernest Glenning, decides to gather the original cast of “Floradora” for a charity performance, and Mary again meets Courtland. After the Show they are both injured in an apartment fire and from their hospital beds, by telephone, they arrange their wedding to coincide with that of Maryon and Ernest.

results.title: Pageant of the high country
results.brief_description: North eastern Victoria, a land of rugged mountains and fertile valleys takes on a variety of aspects with changes in weather. As the winter snows melt, cattle are taken to graze on the lush plains of Mount Dargo and Bogong, under the supervision of the Soil Conservation Authority. The Kiewa hydro-electricity plant harnesses the waters of the mountain rivers. In winter it becomes a popular playground for ski enthusiasts.
